info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 2:41AM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow diminishing by late this morning. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will create significant blowing and drifting of snow over mountain passes. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains and Helena Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and has resulted in some road closures. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow diminishes this morning, but gusty winds will create significant drifting and blowing snow hazards over mountain passes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
